definition: to digress/to stray from the subject
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]

sentences.english: Put details and digressions in footnotes. Then delete the footnotes.
sentences.chinese: 把细节和离题的东西放到脚注，然后删除脚注。

sentences.english: By my rambling digressions I perceive myself to be grown old.
sentences.chinese: 依我絮叨离题的程度来看，我知道我的确老了。

sentences.english: I usually become digressive when I am exhausted or bored.
sentences.chinese: 通常我疲惫厌倦时，就会离题。

sentences.english: But I digress, onto Matt's woods.
sentences.chinese: 我离题了，我们还是说说马特的森林吧。

sentences.english: They are a little impatient at her digression.
sentences.chinese: 他们对她离题的话显得有点不耐烦。

sentences.english: I'll tell you a funny story,if I may digress from my subject for a monent.
sentences.chinese: 如果允许我离题一会儿，我就给你们讲个有趣的故事。

sentences.english: The discussion trailed off into futilities.
sentences.chinese: 讨论离题越来越远，变成了空谈。

sentences.english: Or maybe they will return to flame him. But I digress.
sentences.chinese: 有或者他们会返回去热烈拥护他，但我离题了。

sentences.english: His answer was wide of the mark.
He never stepped aside when he explained some things.
sentences.chinese: 他在说明问题时，他的谈话从不离题。

sentences.english: Weve gone too far off the point. Lets return to the topic under discussion.
sentences.chinese: 咱们离题太远了，还是回到正题上来吧。

sentences.english: But stretch a topic too far and usually it will collapse into irrelevancy.
sentences.chinese: 但若是扩展太远，往往因为离题而写出失败的文章。

sentences.english: A thousand words from the pen in a stream, but ten thousand li away from the subject.

definition: to get off the main topic/to digress
to digress/to stray from the topic
(of a writing etc) to have no substance (idiom)/to carry no weight
a bunch of nonsense/verbose and rambling
to bring out the main theme/to make the point/to bring out the substance concisely
